snippet: Dwight Sagaray, 35, was second-in-command at the Venezuelan Embassy in Kenya, even briefly heading the mission. He is now stripped of immunity and accused of murdering his boss.
abstract: Dwight Sagaray, formerly the second-in-command at the Venezuelan Embassy in Kenya, is stripped of immunity and accused of murdering his boss, Olga Fonseca Gimenez; several legal experts speculate why the Venezuelan government had originally promoted Sagaray so fast and why it had decided so quickly to take away his immunity.

byline.contributor: María Eugenia Díaz contributed reporting from Caracas, and Reuben Kyama from Nairobi, Kenya.

lead_paragraph: Dwight Sagaray, 35, was second-in-command at the Venezuelan Embassy in Kenya, even briefly heading the mission. He is now stripped of immunity and accused of murdering his boss.

headline.seo: Venezuelan Diplomat Faces Murder Charges in Kenya
headline.main: A Venezuelan Diplomat’s Swift Rise Ends With a Murder in Kenya
headline.print_headline: A Venezuelan Diplomat’s Swift Rise Ends With a Murder in Kenya
